message_1: What is the maximum number of disjoint connected subsets that can be obtained by removing exactly 1 point from the unit circle?
message_2: When you remove exactly 1 point from the unit circle, you will break the circle into a single connected subset, which is an open arc. So, the maximum number of disjoint connected subsets that can be obtained by removing exactly 1 point from the unit circle is 1.
